posts._title: Fred F. Sears – The Miami Story (1954)
posts.title: The Miami Story
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:When Miami, Florida became national headquarters for a ten billion dollar crime syndicate ruled by crime-czar Tomy Brill (Luther Adler), whose chief henchman is Ted Delacorte (John Baer), a citizen’s committee enlists the aid of a reformed gangster Mick Flakk (Barry Sullivan), a widower with a ten-year-old son, pretends to move in on Brill’s rackets. …

posts.title: Billy Budd
posts.excerpt: H.M.S. Avenger is headed into battle against the French fleet during the Napoleonic Wars, and the dark shadow of two recent mutinies in the English fleet concern Captain Vere. He relies on his cruel and often sadistic Master-at-Arms John Claggert to maintain what he believes to be tenuous order and discipline aboard the ship. When …

posts.title: Exit Elena
posts.excerpt: Exit Elena Flickers With Ordinary Madness“The comedies of John Cassavetes cut deeper,” Thom Andersen explains in Los Angeles Plays Itself, “because he had an eye and an ear for ordinary madness—those flickers of lunacy that can separate us from our fellows.” Nathan Silver’s Exit Elena adopts many working methods typical of a Cassavetes production—shot almost …

posts._title: Stuart Heisler & Mark Sandrich – Blue Skies (1946)
posts.title: Blue Skies
posts.excerpt: Jed Potter looks back on a love triangle conducted over the course of years and between musical numbers. Dancer Jed loves showgirl Mary, who loves compulsive nightclub-opener Johnny, who can’t stay committed to anything in life for very long.

posts._title: Antonio Reis & Margarida Cordeiro – Rosa de Areia AKA Desert Rose (1989)
posts.title: Rosa de Areia
posts.excerpt: “Marking a stylistically and philosophically turn away from the earlier features, The Sand Rose is Reis and Cordeiro’s most abstract, conceptual and literary work. The film’s collage structure gathers texts from multiple sources – including Kafka and Montaigne – and crafts a world of theatrical artifice far from the documentary inspired naturalism of Ana and …

posts.title: Prince Valiant
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Young Prince Valiant, son of the exiled King of Scandia, journeys to Camelot to become a knight at King Arthur’s Round Table. He hopes to help his father reclaim his throne from the pagan Viking usurper Sligon and restore the Christian faith to their homeland. On his journey he stumbles upon a mysterious Black Knight …

posts._title: Kunitoshi Manda – Seppun AKA The Kiss (2007)
posts.title: Seppun
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:One day Kyoko watches television and sees a man turning himself in to the police after murdering a family. Something within Kyoko connects with the man, as she recognizes a similar soul. Despite the worries of the killer’s lawyer, she approaches the killer and the two start corresponding…

posts._title: Frank Capra – The Bitter Tea of General Yen (1933)
posts.title: The Bitter Tea of General Yen
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:The American missionary Megan Davis arrives in Shanghai during the Chinese Civil War to marry the missionary Dr. Robert Strife. However, Robert postpones their wedding to rescue some orphans in an orphanage in Chapei section that is burning in the middle of a battlefield. posts._title: Bruno Mattei – Robowar – Robot da guerra (1988)
posts.title: Robowar – Robot da guerra
posts.excerpt: A clone/mix of PREDATOR, RAMBO, and ROBOCOP gone nuts jungle flick with an international cast, exotic locale and good electronic music.
